meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or denoting the part of the autonomic nervous system that inhibits or opposes the physiological effects of the sympathetic nervous system.
meanings.sent1: The parasympathetic response helps calm the body down after a stressful situation.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained how the parasympathetic system works to regulate heart rate and digestion.
meanings.sent3: When the parasympathetic system kicks in, it's like a gentle breeze soothing a storm.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a parasympathetic effect on him, easing his tension instantly.
meanings.sent5: The parasympathetic nature of the scene brought a sense of peace and tranquility.

meanings.sent1: The parasympathetic sends signals to slow down the heart rate.
meanings.sent2: He learned about the function of the parasympathetic in his biology class.
meanings.sent3: The parasympathetic nerve seemed to have a mind of its own, acting independently.
meanings.sent4: In the web of nerves, the parasympathetic stood out like a delicate thread.
meanings.sent5: The parasympathetic fiber gently whispered messages of relaxation to the body.
